feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Flood Watch issued September 15 at 7:21AM AKDT until September 16 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...The following areas, Central Inner Channels. This includes the city of Petersburg. * WHEN...Until noon AKDT today.

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued September 15 at 3:59AM AKDT until September 16 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...South winds 25 to 40 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected. * WHERE...Eastern Alaska Range, north of Black Rapids. * WHEN...Until midnight AKDT Friday night. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued September 14 at 4:06PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A GLACIER-DAMMED LAKE OUTBURST NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a glacier-dammed lake outburst continues. * WHERE...Kenai River downstream of the bridge in Soldotna. * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued September 15 at 3:16AM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT... WHAT...Surf heights of 9 to 11 feet WHERE...South and east shores of all islands WHEN...Through this afternoon. IMPACTS...Expect some strong breaking waves, shorebreak, and strong longshore and rip currents making water recreation difficult and
entry.cap:areaDesc: Manua; Rose Atoll; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued September 15 at 9:30AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR MARICOPA COUNTY INCLUDING THE PHOENIX METRO AREA FRIDAY... The Arizona Department of Environmental Quality (ADEQ) has issued an Ozone High Pollution Advisory for the Phoenix Metro Area on Saturday. This means that forecast weather conditions combined with existing ozone levels are expected to result in local maximum 8-hour ozone

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 15 at 5:14AM PDT until September 15 at 10:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Strong rip currents and elevated surf. Surf will be 3- 5 feet with sets to 6 feet. Highest surf will be in northern Orange County. * WHERE...Orange County Coastal Areas.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued September 15 at 8:50AM CDT until September 16 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Texas... Palo Duro Creek at Spearman 6W affecting Hansford County. For the Palo Duro Creek...including Spearman 6W...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW MORNING...

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 3:18AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 105 AND 109 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED TODAY... The combination of warm temperatures and high dewpoints will produce heat indices between 105 and 109 degrees today. Residents with outdoor activities planned are urged to drink plenty of water, wear light weight and light colored clothing and take frequent breaks from the heat. Young children and pets should
entry.cap:areaDesc: Coastal Kleberg; Coastal Nueces; Coastal San Patricio; Duval; Inland Kleberg; Inland Nueces; Inland San Patricio; Jim Wells; Kleberg Islands; La Salle; Live Oak; McMullen; Nueces Islands; Webb

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued September 15 at 11:00AM AST until September 15 at 5:00PM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heat indices of 108 degrees or more. * WHERE...Northwest, northeast Puerto Rico, and St. Croix. * WHEN...From 10 AM AST until 5 PM AST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Heat exhaustion is likely with prolonged exposure.

entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued September 15 at 10:40AM AST until September 15 at 6:00PM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Life-threatening rip currents due to breaking waves between 7 and 9 feet, and occasionally higher. * WHERE...Beaches of northeast Puerto Rico, Culebra, and the U.S. Virgin Islands.
